snippet: Amy Cappellazzo, the chairwoman of postwar and contemporary development at Christie’s, has a quartz crystal she says has no significance or worth. Unless she says so.
abstract: David Colman Possessed column on Christie's chairwoman Amy Cappellazzo, who keeps a quartz crystal on her desk as a touchstone for a personal brand of materialism that believes the simplest objects can be imbued with as much meaning as religious artifacts.
lead_paragraph: Amy Cappellazzo, the chairwoman of postwar and contemporary development at Christie’s, has a quartz crystal she says has no significance or worth. Unless she says so.

headline.seo: Amy Cappellazzo of Christie’s Keeps a Quartz Crystal - Possessed
